title: Sheriff’s office releases name of teen who died in shooting
content:
The Payette County Sheriff’s Office has released the name of the teenager who died of a gunshot wound in New Plymouth Tuesday night.
Deondre Kinney, 17, of Payette, was found dead when sheriff’s deputies responded to a report of shots fired in the 5000 block of Idaho Highway 52.
The sheriff’s office and Idaho State Police detectives are investigating, but the shooting was “an isolated event,” according to a news release from the sheriff’s office. The community is not in danger.
No arrests have been made. Sheriff’s Lt. Andy Creech told the Argus Wednesday that the cause of death was not suicide, but that it remains unclear whether the shooting was accidental.
